evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Section 1079 (a) (11) contains a categorical exclusion of all surgeries for the treatments for gender dysphoria. The exclusionary language, in relevant part, prohibits: Surgery which improves physical appearance but is not expected to significantly restore functions (including mammary augmentation, face lifts, and sex gender changes) may not be provided…

extracted.value: 10 U.S.C. § 1079(a)(11) prohibits surgical treatments for gender dysphoria in military healthcare for dependents

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Jane was diagnosed with gender dysphoria at age 17 in 2018.

extracted.value: Jane Doe diagnosed with gender dysphoria at age 17 (2018), requiring medically necessary treatments including hormone replacement therapy and surgeries

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: In 2019 and 2021, Jane underwent facial feminization and voice feminization surgeries recommended by her doctors for her gender transition. These surgeries are standard of care treatments for gender dysphoria.

extracted.value: TRICARE denied coverage for facial feminization and voice feminization surgeries despite medical necessity

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Gender dysphoria is recognized in the American Psychiatric Association’s Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, Fifth Edition; the World Health Organization’s International Classification of Diseases; and by leading medical and mental health professional groups.

extracted.value: Gender dysphoria recognized as a serious medical condition by WPATH Standards of Care, AMA, APA, and DSM-5
